params._worldId: The WorldID instance that will verify the proofs

verifyAndExecute(address,uint256,uint256.details: Feel free to rename this method however you want! We've used `claim`, `verify` or `execute` in the past.

params.nullifierHash: The nullifier hash for this proof, preventing double signaling (returned by the JS widget).
params.proof: The zero-knowledge proof that demonstrates the claimer is registered with World ID (returned by the JS widget).
params.root: The root of the Merkle tree (returned by the JS widget).
params.signal: An arbitrary input from the user, usually the user's wallet address (check README for further details)

documentation.text: @notice Thrown when attempting to reuse a nullifier
@dev The World ID instance that will be used for verifying proofs
@dev Whether a nullifier hash has been used already. Used to guarantee an action is only performed once by a single person
